page.title: 03Farming (continued)
page.content: {Science and Technology}is increas- ing its influence on farming, in artificial insemination (principally cattle), pregnancy and blood testing. Considerable use is made of ADAS and the advisory service provided by Merchants of agricultural products. Artificial and organic fertilizers are used regularly to-gether with pesticides, fungicides and weedkillers. These are applied from the ground and air. Farm operation is mixed; there is owner occupation, tenant occupation of private and Council owned farms, and management for large Companies. All farming in the area makes extensive use of mechanised equipment. The labour force has been drastically reduced; some large arable farms operate with only two men and occasional casual labour.
